Job Description: Job Description: Are you passionate about transforming education and building partnerships that empower educators and students? Join our team at the Bill of Rights Institute as Manager, Program Partnerships. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in establishing and managing relationships with school districts and educators, driving sales opportunities, and fostering collaborations to advance civic education initiatives. If you excel in dynamic environments and are committed to making a tangible impact in education, this position is perfect for you. Responsibilities: Establish and maintain relationships with school districts and educators to facilitate collaboration and support the adoption of resources from the Bill of Rights Institute. Collaborate with key stakeholders to identify and cultivate leads for program opportunities. Initiate and oversee partnerships with state social studies councils, historical societies, museums, and other civic education organizations to broaden outreach and impact. Represent the Bill of Rights Institute at social studies conferences by staffing vendor tables, promoting awareness, and fostering connections that may lead to partnerships and programs. Conduct market research and outreach within designated regions to compile lists of potential partnership prospects. Monitor and manage program budgets, collaborating with our Development team to ensure accurate reporting and compliance with financial requirements. Provide leadership in delivering professional development sessions for classroom teachers, emphasizing the effective use of resources from the Bill of Rights Institute, and incorporating best pedagogical practices. Work with our Manager, Program Implementation and Programs Coordinator to design and implement programs nationwide. Oversee the management of school district relationships from initial engagement through program completion, ensuring satisfaction and successful outcomes. Allocate 30% of your schedule to travel, engaging with stakeholders, attending conferences, and conducting outreach activities, as necessary. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in education or related field (Master's degree preferred). Proven experience in cultivating and managing relationships with school districts, educators, and educational organizations. Strong business development skills, with a track record of identifying and pursuing educational partnership opportunities. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage diverse stakeholders. Knowledge of educational trends, curriculum standards, and pedagogical strategies in social studies education preferred. Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of juggling multiple priorities and deadlines effectively. A willingness to travel frequently and work flexible hours as needed to fulfill the demands of the role. If you are enthusiastic about driving positive change in education and are eager to play a pivotal role in advancing civic education by supporting educators, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in empowering educators and students with the resources they need to become informed and engaged citizens. Your cover letter and resume should demonstrate your writing skills and accuracy as well as let us know why you want to work at the Bill of Rights Institute. Please apply directly through our website at https://billofrightsinstitute.org/about-bri/join-our-team or through Indeed. Include a cover letter describing why you want to work for the Bill of Rights Institute. Must include your salary expectations to be considered. Our culture is affirming and collegial. We are achievers. We enjoy working with each other; our interactions are positive, respectful, and filled with good humor. We reward excellence and achievement. We embrace all diversity in our work and our workforce. It really is that special here! Elementary Education Internship Are you passionate about transforming elementary education and utilizing the methods and best practices you have learned in college before graduation? Join our team at the Bill of Rights Institute and you will be working with our learning design team as we create new educational resources for elementary school educators. If you excel in dynamic environments and are committed to making a tangible impact in education, this position is perfect for you. Responsibilities: Collaborate with the K-8 Learning Designer to Lexile content, including readings, articles, and other learning materials. Conduct research on state social studies standards and assist in aligning content to these standards. Work closely with the Education Team to develop supplemental resources within the 3-5 curriculum. Support the creation of new educational materials, including interactive activities, worksheets, and assessments. Ensure consistency in branding usage across all new materials, including maintaining visual design guidelines. Assist in proofreading and editing educational materials to ensure accuracy, clarity, and quality. Qualifications: Currently pursuing undergraduate studies in elementary education or history with a focus on teaching. Passion for education and a strong commitment to making a positive impact on student learning experiences. Knowledge of state social studies standards, preferably with experience in aligning content to these standards. Excellent research skills, with the ability to collect and analyze information from reliable sources. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines. Proficient in written and verbal communication, with exceptional attention to detail. Experience in instructional material development or curriculum design is a plus. Proficiency in using educational technology tools and applications is desirable.
